item.title: STEM: Pop rocket
item.description: The Alka-Seltzer pop rocket experiment is a fun and simple science activity that demonstrates principles of chemical reactions, gas production, and Newton’s Third Law of Motion. This experiment involves creating a small “rocket” using common household items: Alka-Seltzer tablets, water, and a film canister or similar container with a tight-fitting lid.

item.title: STEM: Pop rocket
item.description: The Alka-Seltzer pop rocket experiment is a fun and simple science activity that demonstrates principles of chemical reactions, gas production, and Newton’s Third Law of Motion. This experiment involves creating a small “rocket” using common household items: Alka-Seltzer tablets, water, and a film canister or similar container with a tight-fitting lid.

item.title: Funding: Popcorn
item.description: Popcorn program is the only money earning activity once a year allows the Scouts to raise funds to pay their own way through scouting, including summer camps, equipment, and other experience. Scout with the help of Registered Adult Partner creates an account in Trail’s End and co-ordinate with the Pack Popcorn chair to participate in the program. Logistics for Popcorn program: Create account in Train’s End. Signup for the shifts (Max 2 per Scout) in Trail’s End.

item.title: Pack Event: Pinewood Derby
item.description: Register here[CLOSED] About Pinewood Derby Since it was first introduced in 1953 by Don Murphy, a Cubmaster in California, Pine Wood Derby(PWD) has become one of the most popular and favorite activity for cubscouts. It is one of the most celebrated tradition in Cubscouts. Pack499 had a blasting performance in 2022 with multiple awards in various categories. PWD is about creativity, innovation and parent/caregiver - scout collaboration span multiple weeks to build a car from a single piece of derby and compete among the cubscouts.

item.title: Pack Event: Raingutter Regatta
item.description: Saturday, Nov 16th 2024! Register here for participating. If you have participated in voting in Den channel, this is not required. How to prepare ? This blog is a good starting point and you may explore other resources for information that falls within the recommended BSA cubscouts standards in preparing the boat for the racing. Racing Groups & Prizes LIONs/TIGERs Bears Webelos/AoL There will be 1st, 2nd, 3rd places and participation recognition for each participant!

item.title: Wolf
item.description: 2nd Grade/7Y | subscribe p499-wolves for Pack-499 resources About Wolf Den | Requirements BobCat Badge (DONE) Resources Adventure 1: Call of the Wild [Inprogerss] 7 basic Knots Wolves learn Overhand and Square knots only. Adventure 2: Council Fire (Duty to Country) [Not started] Adventure 3: Duty to God Footsteps (DONE) Adventure 4: Howling at the Moon [Inprogerss] Adventure 5: Paws on the path (DONE) Cubscout Six Essentials Leave No Trace Spatial Awareness Adventure 6: Running With the Pack [Not started]

item.title: About
item.description: Our Pack is all about adventures and growth—whether it’s earning new ranks through exciting challenges, going on regular outdoor adventures, learning essential life skills, or enjoying the great outdoors with camping trips. Our scouts are a fantastic bunch of courteous, kind, respectful, and helpful kids who support each other throughout. If you know any families that might be interested, feel free to reach out! Let’s help the next generation grow in confidence and character together, Bi’ithnillah.

item.title: Activities
item.description: From council

item.title: Adult Leader Contributions
item.description: Once you are familiar about Cubscouting, get started with onboarding process: 1. Register with BSA APPLY: Create account in scouting.org*. Apply to our Unit on BSA website GET APPROVED: Complete Youth Protection Training*. PARTICIPATE: Complete AB-506 VOLUNTEER PROCESS*. Complete LiveScan background check* Attend position specific training after talking to your assigned Den Leader Complete the Leader Onboarding Process. It sounds overwhelming, but most of it is a one-time activity and the content is very useful.

item.title: Registration
item.description: Register here Have questions about registrations? Email to: registrations@sbiapack499.org

item.title: Training for adults
item.description: All registered adult leaders and the volunteering adults must complete YPT and maintain ACTIVE status through out the scouting.
